blog.name: stopmakingliberalslookbad
blog.title: STOP MAKING LIBERALS LOOK BAD!
blog.description:
Asks will be turned back on once Carlos Albuquerque fucks off.

35. Female. Social democrat. Agnostic. Critical (not gender critical) feminist. Pro-social justice, but anti-extremism. I am well aware that my race, sexual orientation, gender identity, and age offer me certain privileges, thank you very much.

I don't do trigger warnings. I can't keep track of everyone's triggers.

I mostly access the site on my mobile browser, so I won't always see notifications or IMs. I'm not ignoring anybody, I swear!

PLEASE READ MY FAQ BEFORE ASKING ANY QUESTIONS, ESPECIALLY IF IT'S REGARDING MY URL!

Twitter: stfuregressives

summary: I didn't think it would be her last post either, I only found out after she deactivated and left a goodbye message on discord....
question: I didn't think it would be her last post either, I only found out after she deactivated and left a goodbye message on discord. :( Hopefully she'll be happier without this hellsite. Speaking of which, what's with the hate for Captain Marvel? The trailer didn't hint at any kind of Feminist(TM) massage and the actress' opinions (w/e they are, I haven't seen proof of anything one way or the other) are irrelevant to the movie. The only problem with her is wooden acting, I expected better of an Oscar.
answer:
Her Twitter is gone too. She must be unplugging completely.

As for the Captain Marvel thing, you know how people on the internet are. They convince themselves of something, despite the lack of evidence, and completely run with it.

summary: Critican a Brie Larson por no sonreír en Capitana Marvel… ¡y su respuesta es hilarante!
title: Critican a Brie Larson por no sonreír en Capitana Marvel… ¡y su respuesta es hilarante!
body:
Capitana Marvel podrá tener todas las habilidades imaginables, pero hay una muy simple que algunos fans le reprochan no practicar: la sonrisa. Y es que Brie Larson ha sido criticada por “no sonreír” en su papel de Carol Danvers / Capitana Marvel… y la respuesta de la actriz ha sido hilarante.

Recordemos que el primer tráiler de Capitana Marvel se difundió el pasado 18 de septiembre y fue visto más de 30 millones de veces en apenas 3 días. Desde entonces, los fans de todo el mundo esperan con expectación el estreno de la primera película de Marvel protagonizada por una mujer –y se espera que el éxito de la cinta haga por la compañía lo que Wonder Woman hizo por DC.

Pero, como no podía ser de otra forma, la avalancha de comentarios positivos que generó el tráiler vino acompañada de otro buen número de críticas –muchas de ellas señalando la actitud “excesivamente seria” de Brie Larson. Un usuario incluso llegó a difundir imágenes de la actriz en su papel de Capitana Marvel, con sonrisas “pegadas” encima de su expresión original:

I fixed #CaptainMarvel! Thanks @faceapp_ai.@DiversityAndCmx @TheQuartering @OneAngryGamerHD pic.twitter.com/SWx1ReRuJN

— Turd Flinging Monkey (@TFMonkeyYouTube) 18 de septiembre de 2018

Ante esta delirante crítica, Larson se negó a quedarse de brazos cruzados y respondió publicando en su Instagram Story una hornada de imágenes de superhéroes masculinos con sonrisas impostadas:

.@brielarson put these pics on Instagram story. Legend #CaptainMarvel pic.twitter.com/jjSv643I7d

— Geeks of Color (@GeeksOfColor) 20 de septiembre de 2018

“Brie Larson puso estas imágenes en Instagram Story. Leyenda”.

Pero la actriz no fue la única en responder con más sonrisas forzadas…

I saw some dude use an app to make Carol Danvers/Captain Marvel smile more, so I thought I’d do the same with the male Marvel superheroes.

I think we can all agree that this is a totally normal, non-creepy thing to do. pic.twitter.com/jLONpjGQch

— David Chen (@davechensky) 20 de septiembre de 2018

“Vi a un tipo usar una app para hacer que Carol Danvers / Capitana Marvel sonriese más, así que pensé en hacer lo mismo con los superhéroes masculinos de Marvel. Creo que podemos estar de acuerdo en que hacer esto es totalmente normal y no da miedo”.

pic.twitter.com/uXDZEHkARo

— Jose De Leon III (@JoseSalvadorIII) 20 de septiembre de 2018

Puedes ver a la Capitana Marvel (con su actitud normal de superhéroe) en el tráiler de la película, cuyo estreno se espera para el 8 de marzo de 2019:


Para seguir leyendo:
Un MOMENTAZO de Capitana Marvel tiene a los usuarios desconcertados ¿en serio abofetea a una anciana?
¿Por qué Captain Marvel se establece en los 90? ¡Tenemos la respuesta!

Imágenes: ©Disney / Twitter

summary: i’m the same age as you, and thank you for helping me realize that i totally had a big fat crush on brie larson as a teen who...
question: i’m the same age as you, and thank you for helping me realize that i totally had a big fat crush on brie larson as a teen who had no idea she was a lesbian
answer:
Listen, there are SEVERAL hot ladies in Scott Pilgrim… really, it’s a gold mine. Brie Larson, Mary Elizabeth Winstead, Anna Kendrick, Aubrey Plaza, Ellen Wong, and Mae Whitman.

If you weren’t at least A LITTLE BIT GAY after watching it, something might be wrong hahaha. (Oh and if any of you haven’t watched it, DO IT!)

Also I find it hilarious how many times Brie has played a mean girl when she’s like the sweetest lil bean… I love her so much and I’m glad you do too!

summary: I just watched a very odd film called Basmati Blues. It’s a romantic comedy musical about a scientist, played by Brie Larson,...
body: I just watched a very odd film called Basmati Blues. It’s a romantic comedy musical about a scientist, played by Brie Larson, who goes to India to sell terminator technology-enhanced rice and falls in love with a local farmer, played by Utkarsh Ambudkar, who is trying to take down the company she works for. It’s loaded to the brim with tropes and clichés (Donald Sutherland villain/white savior/Indian stereotypes) and features a sung/piano solo by, I kid you not, Scott Bakula. It feels like it could have been made in 2004.

reblog.comment: I just watched a very odd film called Basmati Blues. It’s a romantic comedy musical about a scientist, played by Brie Larson, who goes to India to sell terminator technology-enhanced rice and falls in love with a local farmer, played by Utkarsh Ambudkar, who is trying to take down the company she works for. It’s loaded to the brim with tropes and clichés (Donald Sutherland villain/white savior/Indian stereotypes) and features a sung/piano solo by, I kid you not, Scott Bakula. It feels like it could have been made in 2004.

trail.content_raw: I just watched a very odd film called Basmati Blues. It’s loaded to the brim with tropes and clichés (Donald Sutherland villain/white savior/Indian stereotypes) and features a sung/piano solo by, I kid you not, Scott Bakula. It feels like it could have been made in 2004.
